update.title: Building Editor: Custom colors

content.raw:
No problem at all. Cut-off dates for the release process can occur at inopportune times.

We can sneak a PIMPL-ization of BuildingEditorPalette into gazebo5, if you can do that early this morning. Once gazebo5 is released, you can then backport this pull request to gazebo5 and we'll make another release with this feature.
content.html:
No problem at all. Cut-off dates for the release process can occur at inopportune times.

We can sneak a PIMPL-ization of BuildingEditorPalette into gazebo5, if you can do that early this morning. Once gazebo5 is released, you can then backport this pull request to gazebo5 and we'll make another release with this feature.

content.raw: Sorry it took so long to get this through. If there are no more unaddressed comments, I'll merge this with default. I guess it will be necessary to update the tutorial.
content.html: Sorry it took so long to get this through. If there are no more unaddressed comments, I'll merge this with default. I guess it will be necessary to update the tutorial.

content.raw: I re-targeted to default because we had entered code freeze, and this looks like a new feature.
content.html: I re-targeted to default because we had entered code freeze, and this looks like a new feature.

content.raw: Yup, someone re-targeted it to default. It wasn't me, so I'm not sure what to do...
content.html: Yup, someone re-targeted it to default. It wasn't me, so I'm not sure what to do...

content.raw: A final note: just a reminder that this PR is pointing to default. If we want it inside gazebo5 it needs to be reassigned.
content.html: A final note: just a reminder that this PR is pointing to default. If we want it inside gazebo5 it needs to be reassigned.

content.raw: That's super convenient!
content.html: That's super convenient!

update.description:

update.title: Building Editor: Custom colors

content.raw:
commit f411254

Made custom color dialog non modal, so the moment the user clicks a color it is ready to be used. The user can use the color, then choose another one and use that, and so on. The user can leave the dialog open and draw other things on the scene, then come back and pick colors directly from the dialog again.
content.html:
commit f411254

Made custom color dialog non modal, so the moment the user clicks a color it is ready to be used. The user can use the color, then choose another one and use that, and so on. The user can leave the dialog open and draw other things on the scene, then come back and pick colors directly from the dialog again.

update.title: Building Editor: Custom colors

content.raw: That's a good thought. I'm not sure what the best solution is. In Illustrator, the swatch palette can remain open at all times, but when creating a new swatch from a color picker, the color picker is modal so it must be closed before you're able to apply the color. I don't foresee a problem with making the color picker modeless in this case. Seems convenient to allow users to Add to Custom Colors, apply the color to the scene, and (still in the color picker) repeat with a new color.
content.html: That's a good thought. I'm not sure what the best solution is. In Illustrator, the swatch palette can remain open at all times, but when creating a new swatch from a color picker, the color picker is modal so it must be closed before you're able to apply the color. I don't foresee a problem with making the color picker modeless in this case. Seems convenient to allow users to Add to Custom Colors, apply the color to the scene, and (still in the color picker) repeat with a new color.

content.raw:
Long time without touching the model and building editors and ... wow impressive work! congrats.

Apart from minors comments, seems to work fine for me.
content.html:
Long time without touching the model and building editors and ... wow impressive work! congrats.

content.raw: Looks like we have three times the same block code in three different files. Maybe refactoring could help (could be done during or after this pull request).
content.html: Looks like we have three times the same block code in three different files. Maybe refactoring could help (could be done during or after this pull request).

After the logic above, we probably expect at this point an index with a valid range of values (index > 0?). As a QA measure you can include a check here to be sure:

...
  GZ_ASSERT(index > 0, "Color index is broken < 0")
  this->floorColorComboBox->setCurrentIndex(index);
}

content.raw: You mean `currentMode` in general, or just to setting it to empty at startup?
content.html: You mean currentMode in general, or just to setting it to empty at startup?

content.raw: Nice! One minor usability comment. Rotating or panning the camera while a color is selected causes the action to be canceled on mouse release. It would be nice to keep the color on the mouse.
content.html: Nice! One minor usability comment. Rotating or panning the camera while a color is selected causes the action to be canceled on mouse release. It would be nice to keep the color on the mouse.

Can we replace this line with:

this->currentMode = "color_custom";

and remove the two previous lines?

content.raw: It looks good to me! I'm ready to approve when the minor comments are addressed.
content.html: It looks good to me! I'm ready to approve when the minor comments are addressed.

content.raw: this->textureList (check the rest of the file)
content.html: this->textureList (check the rest of the file)

content.raw: this->colorList (check the rest of the file)
content.html: this->colorList (check the rest of the file)

content.raw: Do you need this?
content.html: Do you need this?

This looks really cool!

I know you've already done user testing, but I'll just add one comment related to usability. After using programs like photoshop or illustrator, I'm used to seeing a color pop-up window that can stay open, whereas this color selector needs to be closed before I can change the color of an object. I wanted to pick one color then immediately use it on a wall with the color selector still open, then pick another color. Not a deal-breaker, just a comment.

@spaepcke
